definition: lump (of earth)/chunk/piece/classifier for pieces of cloth, cake, soap etc/(coll.) classifier for money and currency units

sentences.english: The case of a blood clot, or amenorrhea, pills mill liquor service is available.
sentences.chinese: 如是血块或闭经可用丸药磨酒服。

sentences.english: However, Mrs Lee did get a CT scan earlier and the location of the blood clot was identified.
sentences.chinese: 不过，李夫人终能提前接受脑部扫描，确定血块所在。

sentences.english: I hope it’s nothing like blood pudding.
sentences.chinese: 我希望它不要像血块布丁。

sentences.english: The blood clots are brown to tan because of organization.
sentences.chinese: 机化使血块呈现棕色到黑色之间。

sentences.english: Cervical erosion, the drug, the smell of blood clots with tissue.
sentences.chinese: 宫颈糜烂，上药后，有腥味血块组织。

sentences.english: Rizzoli pulled her hand from the wound. In her gloved palm wascupped a tiny clot of blood, like a bright red bead.
sentences.chinese: 芮黎真把手拿出来，手掌上握着一个小小的血块。

sentences.english: There were pools of blood and gore on the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 人行道上有一摊摊血和血块。

sentences.english: The blood caked around his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 他的嘴的周围粘着血块。

sentences.english: SHAKIR:He created man from a clot.
It’s worse than cooked congealed blood.

definition: clotted blood/extravasated blood (leaking into surrounding tissue)/thrombosis
to bleed/bleeding/(fig.) to spend money in large amounts
hematoma/swelling of soft tissue due to internal hemorrhage
(in Chinese medicine) stasis (of blood or other fluids)
hematoma (internal blood clot)/extravasated blood (spilt into surrounding tissue)/contusion
